oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-12-06 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 6, 1958. This show celebrates the 1000th network broadcast of the Prince Albert Grand Ole Opry, featuring Grant Turner (announcer), and performances by Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys, Pee Wee King with Tommy Jackson, the Fruit Jar Drinkers, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, the Old Hickory Singers, and Marty Robbins. Also features recorded messages from Roy Acuff, Red Foley, and Tennessee Ernie Ford, and an excerpt of a Hank Williams recording. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chet Atkins; Minnie Pearl; Pee Wee King; Old Hickory Singers; Marty Robbins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Tennessee Ernie Ford talks (recording) -- Grant Turner introduces Chet Atkins -- (Back Home Again In) Indiana (Chet Atkins) -- Grant Turner and Pee Wee King introduce Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl, Pee Wee King) -- Maple On The Hill (Minnie Pearl, Pee Wee King) -- Minnie Pearl and Pee Wee King pay tribute to Rod Brasfield -- Prince Albert commercial (Minnie Pearl, Pee Wee King) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Grant Turner introduces the Old Hickory Singers -- Waiting For The Robert E. Lee (Old Hickory Singers) -- Grant Turner and Pee Wee King introduce Marty Robbins -- Ain't I The Lucky One (Marty Robbins) -- Grant Turner introduces Pee Wee King -- Tennessee Waltz (Pee Wee King, cast) -- Closing statement (Grant Turner) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial -- Station announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States.
